statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Michael Buchanan scored 24 points and tied his career high with 15 rebounds for his ninth double-double this season and South Carolina Upstate won its fourth straight, opening Atlantic Sun play w
article.headline: Buchanan has 24 and 15, SC Upstate downs NJIT 75-65.
article.linkText: Buchanan has 24 and 15, SC Upstate downs NJIT 75-65.
article.story: SPARTANBURG, S.C. -- Michael Buchanan scored 24 points and tied his career high with 15 rebounds for his ninth double-double this season and South Carolina Upstate won its fourth straight, opening Atlantic Sun play with a 75-65 win over NJIT on Saturday. Mike Cunningham added 13 points and Josh Cuthbertson 12 for the Spartans (11-7). Deion Holmes' 3-pointer at the 7:44 mark of the first half put the Spartans in front for good 22-21 and started a 16-2 run. Jure Span's 3-point play and Cunningham's 3-pointer at 2:08 made it 35-23. Cunningham's 3 to open the second half made it 40-30 and but the Highlanders kept battling back. Tim Coleman's 3-point play brought the Highlanders within 66-63 with 2:04 to go but Ramel Thompkins answered with a 3. Mohamed Bendary made a layup for NJIT and the Highlanders missed their final six shots. Coleman scored 16 points and Abdul Lewis 15 for NJIT (8-9), which had a three-game winning streak snapped, and both had 10 rebounds.
